text: That’s so unprofessional.

text: That makes us even funnier, no?

text: I think we're all still hilarious, Liz.

text: Alex's piece was secretly a parody of James Reston. Since Reston was still writing his column for the NYT, we felt it best not to advertise this.
author: TimothyNoah1

text:
Joining us now is Jon Meacham. Jon, what can you tell us about the Mueller Report?

Meacham: Well, Wolf, the sun also ariseth, and the sun goeth down, and hasteth to his place where he arose. The wind goeth toward the south, and turneth about unto the north. That's how I see it.
author: TimothyNoah1

text: [Ed.--Hushes don't descend. Say better pls.]
author: TimothyNoah1

text: That's one thing you can be sure of, Liz. Meanwhile, an expectant hush descends over the capital. (See and raise)
author: TimothyNoah1

text: The real winners here, Liz, are the American people.
author: TimothyNoah1

text: While we're waiting for the Mueller report I think somebody should render Barr's letter in verse, or perhaps set it to music. C'mon hive mind, show us what you can do!
author: TimothyNoah1

text: Martha's abductor in the famous phone-cord-ripping Watergate subplot is now ambassador to the Czech Republic.

text: I think it's vitally important that we in the news business interpret in great detail what the Mueller report says long before any of us has a clue what's in it.

text: George Conway’s precursor was Martha Mitchell, but her story is much more Gothic. The guy who kidnapped her to keep her away from reporters is now our ambassador to the Czech Republic. Unbelievably, he was not asked about this at Senate confirmation.

text: Please go back and read what I wrote. Carter ALMOST won in the EC without winning the popular vote, i.e., Gerry Ford came close to winning the popular vote. It didn’t happen. Carter won both. But the possibility that it could have happened spooked Bob Dole.
author: TimothyNoah1

text: Attending a selective college confers little or no financial benefit (as opposed to status) unless the student comes from a low-income family. Ergo, only folks likely to benefit financially from Rick Singer’s bribes were those who couldn’t afford them.
author: TimothyNoah1

text: Similar action was considered after Jimmy Carter almost won in 1976 without winning the popular vote. Bob Dole testified in favor of abolishing the EC.
author: TimothyNoah1

text: Happy 100th birthday to the Century Foundation, one of many sturdy institutions bequeathed by the Progressive Era. Others include the Consumer’s Union, the National Bureau of Economic Research, and the New Republic.

text: 4.) It will take both parties getting screwed by the EC for the US finally to eliminate it. And that will eventually happen. The End.
author: TimothyNoah1

text: 3.) Nobody understands this, and probably no one will until the EC hands the predidency to a Democrat who didn’t win the popular vote, an outcome Republicans won’t likely accept with the same relative equanimity that Democrats have.
author: TimothyNoah1

text: 2.) ... would gain from reducing Republicans’ rotten-borough advantage in low-population states. But they would also LOSE from reducing the ADVANTAGE the EC gives Democrats by allowing large-population states to allocate electors on a winner-take-all basis.
author: TimothyNoah1

text: 1.) It makes no sense that abolishing the Electoral College should be a partisan issue. In 2012 there were realistic worries late in the game that Mitt Romney would win the popular vote and lose in the EC. This was no fluke. Yes, the Democrats ...

text: Employers are making that complaint at all levels, not just the bottom, b/c yes, the labor market is tight. But minimum wage hikes go a long way toward explaining why it’s tighter at the bottom.

text: Here's what people get paid to yak on Fox News. (Keep in mind that yakking on Fox News is a part-time job.)

text: Wage growth at the bottom is rising in large part because of minimum wage increases. In 2016 Trump supported a higher minimum wage (to $10), but he arrived at that position reluctantly after proposing abolishing a federal minimum, and he's not mentioned it since entering the WH.
author: TimothyNoah1

text: News coverage of Operation Varsity Blues is racing past the how-this-outrageous-scam-worked story to relate the (preprogrammed and ill-informed) what-it-all-means story. It's like trying to write a book review before you've finished reading the book.
author: TimothyNoah1

text: William “Rick” Singer’s audition tape for a reality TV series about his (illegal) college placement business. Only in America.
author: TimothyNoah1

text: “They are only getting more deranged with time.” That’s the president accusing the press of photoshopping Melania pics from last week. (!) Sometimes I think Trump has a tiny Greek chorus inside his brain chanting self-criticisms he struggles to rephrase.
author: TimothyNoah1

text: The otherwise blameless life of Paul Manafort, cont’d.
author: TimothyNoah1

text: That USC has become a status object illustrates my point. Quality has democratized to the point where USC is now a top college. In my day parents would have paid bribes to keep their kids OUT of SC.
author: TimothyNoah1

text: The United States has an oversupply of excellent colleges and an undersupply of U.S.-based students to fill them with. It’s a buyer’s market in terms of access, and the Felicity Huffmans needn’t worry about cost. Only explanation for bribes therefore is invidious distinction.
author: TimothyNoah1

text: Ann Coulter complains about how awful it is to be ostracized to a crowd of 600 paying customers.
author: TimothyNoah1

text: Oh, dear. William "Rick" Singer sold one of his ventures ("The University of Miami Online High School") to the Washington Post Company in 2007. http://www.thekeyworldwide.com/about-the-key/

text: “Da mihi castitatem et continentiam, sed noli modo" (Give me chastity and continence, but not just yet)!” --St. Augustine.

text: Here's how Singer phrases it: "There is a front door which means you get in on your own. The back door is through institutional advancement, which is 10 times as much money. And I’ve created this side door in."
author: TimothyNoah1

text: It's getting lesser by the hour.
author: TimothyNoah1

text: The "front door" is you apply like everybody else and get in. The "back door" is your parents buy you a berth legally (see Kushner, Jared, Harvard's $2.5 million admit). Singer pioneered the "side door," a discounted back door for the haute bourgeoisie involving bribes.
author: TimothyNoah1

text: William "Rick" Singer is author of a 2014 book titled "Getting In: Gaining Admission To Your College of Choice." I love this story!
